revised_title: The Effects of Pressure and Anaesthetics on the Urinary Bladder of the Cat
tldr: This study investigates the activity and response of the urinary bladder of the cat under constant pressure conditions. The bladder tends to maintain a constant volume depending on the pressure, and its response to changes in pressure is orderly. The study also examines the effects of different anaesthetics on the bladder's activity and its response to adrenaline and acetylcholine.
